column4: so, nobody has an answer to my usb 2.0 question? that makes me sad.
what's wrong with usb 2.0?
I've had little quirky things like USB mouse not even being detected, I was only able to fix it with an adapter

i'm having some trouble w/ my external hard drive. i can't get it to run in usb 2.0. i had to modprobe -r ehci_hcd to force it to run at 1.1. i found a kernel option that i'm going to try after i finish copying some files
but i'm curious to know first, what the issue is, and second, what the acpi=noirq kernel option does
it says usb 2.0 is in kernel >= 2.5.2, amazing that it wouldn't work
well, i've found a LARGE number of people having similar problems, unfortunately
most people who have this problem (drive not mounting, etc.) just remove the module, which is horrible solution imho
I wouldn't be surprised if it never did work (2.5 was unstable, may never have made it in)
you have ohci and uhci included as well?
no uchi, but ochi is in lsmod
err... uhci
not sure, wonder what would happen if you said Y instead of M for EHCI HCD
heh, that's not even an option
well, i'm running off the generic kernel... maybe i should try to recompile my own and see if that helps. that's a good idea.
the only other instance of this that I'm seeing is trying to mount a usb 2.0 drive on a usb 1.1 board
i hope it's not hardware. i'll double check my mobo specs, but i'm pretty sure it supports 2.0
http://www.fedoraforum.org/forum/archive/index.php/t-40197.html, there's a workaround that I'm not sure will do anything (changing /sys stuffs)
that's the workaround i'm using now
didn't know that one disabled usb2 as well
oh, wait. i see the other workaround. i'll try the sys one.
thanks for the help.
